creator: j_a_fernandez@yahoo.com
text:
I am doing some experimentation with ClassLoader management.
During debugging, my classloader would be printing messages
to System.out about what is doing. If debugging is OFF, the loader
seem to work as expected. When debug in ON, everything wuld go fine
until ANT changes System.out, soon after the JVM will crash with
"java/lang/Thread" as the only message in a line.

I solved my problem by saving the original value of System.out
and using the saved value instead of System.out. But it took me
a while to realize this. Notice that the classloader in question
is the one actually loading the ANT core classes, maybe there is
something in there. At least we need some additional documentation.

creator: steve_l@iseran.com
text: Agreed, documentation is the solution. Do you have any to submit?

creator: conor@apache.org
text:
I don't think is a bug in Ant as such since you are doing experimentation with
Ant's structure and internal operation - something outside the normal envelop. I
guess what happens is that as part of the initial output operation, the output
demux class triggers a class load, which since you are using System.out, causes
an infinite recursion - and VM crash. 

You must be careful when using System.out within the Ant core, for this reason.
I'm going to close as INVALID but if you do have a document update, please do
provide it.
